description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2022-2601), ensure to apply the relevant updates for your Windows version:

1. Identify your Windows version from the provided list (e.g., Windows 11 or Windows 10).
2. Download the appropriate KB articles for your build number from the Microsoft Update Catalog links provided below:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5041571](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041571)
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5041585](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041585)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5041580](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041580)
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5041782](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5041782)
3. Follow the installation prompts after downloading the update.
4. Restart your system to ensure changes take effect.

**Details**:
This update resolves the buffer overflow which may allow an attacker to bypass the secure boot mechanism. It is crucial to ensure your system is updated to protect against potential exploitation.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure you are running one of the mentioned Windows versions.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with updates.
